thread.title: Trump's round with McIlroy leads to White House statement
thread.title_full: Trump's round with McIlroy leads to White House statement

author: nbcsports.com
title: Trump's round with McIlroy leads to White House statement
text:
RSS 
President Donald Trump's recent round with Rory McIlroy drew attention from more than just the golf media. 
As reported by No Laying Up, McIlroy joined Trump for a round Sunday at Trump International Golf Club in Florida, where McIlroy estimated that Trump "probably shot around an 80." 
At question, though, was the length of the outing, as the White House had apparently told reporters on Sunday that Trump had not played a full round: This story says McIlroy played 18 holes w/ POTUS Sunday, directly contradicting what WH told reporters https://t.co/mojJjyUDki https://t.co/QEVUhJ2smR â€” Mike Memoli (@mikememoli) February 20, 2017 
The White House issued a statement on the round Monday afternoon, confirming that Trump went all 18 holes with the four-time major champ. 
"As stated yesterday, the president played golf. He intended to play a few holes and decided to play longer," the statement read. "He also had a full day of meetings, calls and interviews for the new NSA, which he is continuing (Monday) before returning to Washington, D.C." Article Tags:
